structure:ConceptScheme.structure:Name: SDMX-HD Common Attribute and Metadata Attribute Elements
structure:ConceptScheme.structure:Description: This Concept Scheme contains harmonized data elements used across multiple metadata codelists.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Administrative Source
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Public health initiative to which the indicator is linked.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Dataset Comment
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A comment related to the Dataset

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Indicator Comment
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A comment related to the Indicator

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Observation Comment
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A comment related to the observational data recorded.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Currency
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Currency.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Data Universal Numbering System
structure:Concept.structure:Description: The Data Universal Numbering System, abbreviated as DUNS or D-U-N-S is a system developed and regulated by Dun and Bradstreet (D&B) which assigns a unique numeric identifier to a single business entity

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Definition Date
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Date of definition of the indicator.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Date of Collection
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Date of data collection.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Disaggregation
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Dimensions upon which the indicator is disaggregated.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Documentation
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Explanation of how the indicator value is calculated, including an example or hyperlink.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Data Source
structure:Concept.structure:Description: The different data collection/measurement tool that contain the indicator or data elements needed for the construction of the indicator.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Data Source Type
structure:Concept.structure:Description: The type of data source

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Datatype
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Type of indicator value.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Domain Expert
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Person to contact for questions regarding indicator

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Year of First Available Data
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Year of the first available data available in the dataset for the indicator.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Follow-up Period
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Follow-up time periods.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Country list
structure:Concept.structure:Description: ISO 3166 two-character country code.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Geographic Boundary Type
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Type of boundary entity, e.g. administrative.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Geographic Level
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Geographic Administrative Level

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Geographic Latitude
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Geographic Latitude

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Geographic Longitude
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Geographic Longitude

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Guidelines
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Provides the reference document(s) where the indicator is described, including links.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Health Indicators Framework
structure:Concept.structure:Description: ISO/TS 21667:2004(E) Health Indicators Conceptual Framework (hierarchical parent)

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Keywords
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Keywords for searching for this indicator.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Year of Latest Available Data
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Year of the latest available data available in the dataset for the indicator.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Strengths and limitations
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Explains (1) the strengths of the indicator, i.e. what the meaning of the indicator is within a programmatic context and why it is useful to collect, and (2) the weaknesses of the indicator, i.e. what the indicator does not measure.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Indicator Value of type Logical
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Represent an Indicator of type logical where the observation data is often the answer to a question : Yes or No

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Methodology
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Indicates the methodology for data collection not otherwise specified.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Multiplier
structure:Concept.structure:Description: This number multiplied by the value computes the actual indicator value

structure:Concept.structure:Name: ME Type
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Classification of the indicator based on its Monitoring and Evaluation context.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Maintaining Organization
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Organization maintaining indicator definition.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Operand
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Operand.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Compiling Organization
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Organization that compiled the data.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Responsible Organization
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Lead agency(s) which published the indicator, indicator source.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Other Sources
structure:Concept.structure:Description: All other data sources from which information for the indicator could be collected.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Organization Type
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Organization type.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Periodicity
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Periodicity refers to the frequency of compilation of the data (e.g., a time series could be available at annual frequency but the underlying data are compiled monthly, thus have a monthly periodicity).

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Preferred Definition
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Indicates the preferred indicator among related indicators and versions.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Programme Status
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Programme status.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Programme Type
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Programme type hierarchy.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Preferred Sources
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Ideal data sources at the national level from which information for the indicator should be collected.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Rationale or Purpose
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Rationale or purpose for the indicator.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Date of reporting of data.
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Date of reporting of data.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Reference Period
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Reference period for annual reporting which may include data for various years.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Sample Design
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Survey sample design.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Indicator Set
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Indicator set.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Biologic Sex
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Biologic sex.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Status
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Indicates whether the indicator is in use, not in use, or under development.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Short Name
structure:Concept.structure:Description: This is an abbreviated version of the indicator name.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Sample Size
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Survey sample size.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Type of Data Collection
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Lists the different data collection methods that may be used to collect the indicator data.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Type of Statistics
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Type of statistics of the data point.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Unique Identifier
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define a globally unique identifier

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Code
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define a code

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Acronym
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define an acronym

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Description
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define a description

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Created On UTC Date
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define the date something was created as a UTC date

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Updated On UTC Date
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define the date something was update as a UTC date

structure:Concept.structure:Name: User who created the information
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define the user that created the information

structure:Concept.structure:Name: User who last updated the information
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define the user that last updated the information

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Order By
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define the sort order of some information

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Is Archived
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to flag is some information is Archived. i.e. not currently in use but needed for historical data

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Is Read Only
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define is information is read-only

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Version
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define the version of the information

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Version Status
structure:Concept.structure:Description: A generic way to define the version status of the information

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Calendar Type
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Used to indentify if the calendar for observational data is fiscal or like SDMX's ISO 8601 implemenation

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Start Date Offset
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Used to identify the offset (in days) of the start of the year when the calendar type is not ISO 8601

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Condition
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Condition

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Unit of measure
structure:Concept.structure:Description: The unit associated with an indicator value.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: The group for which the unit of measure belongs
structure:Concept.structure:Description: The group for which the Unit of measure belongs e.g The Unit Group - Weight has unit of measure kg,lbs etc

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Contact
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Individual or organisational contact points for the data or metadata, including information on how to reach the contact points.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Contact email address
structure:Concept.structure:Description: E-mail address of the contact points for the data or metadata

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Contact fax number
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Fax number of the contact points for the data or metadata.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Contact mail address
structure:Concept.structure:Description: The postal address of the contact points for the data or metadata.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Contact function
structure:Concept.structure:Description:
The area of technical responsibility of the contact, such as
"methodology", "database management" or "dissemination".

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Contact phone number
structure:Concept.structure:Description: The telephone number of the contact points for the data or metadata.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Observation Status
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Observation Status
